result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy David Hunt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy David Hunt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Timothy David Hunt was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski DF: Timothy David Hunt appeared from jail. Case called at 11:00. Court reviews file. DE has been revoked. ADA Nieskes updates the court, DE did have a diversion agreement he entered on March 2015. Atty. Kucinski responds and asks for 50 days to allow DE to be released today. DE makes statement. Agent has recommended 50 days. Court at this time will impose 50 days St. Croix County Jail credit for time served. Court will convert $443 to a civil judgment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Liddle .ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Timothy David Hunt appeared. Jenna Hines appears for the diversion program. Case called at 2:15 p.m. ADA Nieskes requesting court to take judicial notice of 15CM193. Makes statement. Atty Kucinski gives argument. ADA Nieskes gives argument. Believes state has meet it's burden and asks court to revoke diversion agreement. Court states violation of 2 items on the diversion agreement. In taking judicial notice, court will find state has met their burden, revoke agreement and enter the conviction on the disorderly conduct charge. ADA Nieskes makes sentencing recommendations. Atty Kucsinski gives recommendations. Victim Ms. Ulm gives statement. Defendant makes statement. Court orders to Count 1 Disorderly Conduct: 
- S/W 6 months probation. Report today
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Follow through with treatment and recommendations by probation agent
- Court costs and supervision fees
-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Ms. Ulm.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.
to Revoke Diversion Agreement. Filed by ADA Nieskes. km
Appointing Atty Kucinski. km
Count 1 - all parties signed this date. c: Def & DA. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski DF: Timothy David Hunt appeared. Case called at 11:46. ADA Nieskes updates the court as to a diversion agreement. Atty. Kucinski agrees.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NC to Ct 1 in 15CM73 removing the domestic violence enhancer. DE sworn.  DE has read and signed the diversion agreement. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 removing the domestic violence enhancer in 15CM73. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2. Diversion agreement has been signed. Crt orders: The diversion agreement coordinator is to provide quarterly updates. Bond continues.
Plea hearing on March 17, 2015 at 11:30 am.

***AMENDED*** 
Per Judge Scott R. Needham February 5, 2015 - amend to No Abusive Contact.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Kristyn U.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Timothy David Hunt appeared from jail.   Includes 15CM73 & 12CM239 (PayH). Court confirms address.    Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.   QUASH WARRANT. Defendant to pay $100.00 within 10 days and then $25.00 per month commencing March 1, 2015.  State to provide discovery within 20 days and motions within 10 days upon receipt of discovery. Court orders face to face settlement conference before next hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 10:15 am.
